title: Bug 17825 ControlExampleText beeps when I choose SWT.MULTI
description: The bug report mentions that ControlExampleText produces beeping sounds when choosing SWT.MULTI and expresses doubt about this behavior.
OB: The report does not provide specific details on the observed behavior, but it implies that unexpected beeping sounds occur when selecting SWT.MULTI.
EB: Expected behavior is not explicitly mentioned, but it should be that selecting SWT.MULTI does not produce any beeping sounds.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Use Build F1 (20020521) on Win2K. 
2. Access the SWT example ControlExample. 
3. Navigate to the Text tab. 
4. Click on the Styles SWT.SINGLE and then switch back to Styles SWT.MULTI. This should reproduce the problem.
